important_phrase: Utilities experienced increased usage in residential and commercial power while industrial sector sales slowed across the District
Home prices continued to modestly improve
Some retailers continued to note that hiring had become easier, particularly for low to mid-skilled positions
Auto lending slowed some in January
District manufacturers indicated that business activity picked up slightly compared with the previous reporting period
Most builders cited flat to slightly up home sales relative to one year earlier; while reports from brokers continued to be mixed
District tourism contacts are cautiously optimistic regarding tourism activity for 2016 as concerns remain about softening demand from international visitors
Outlooks are said to be cautiously positive
Some contacts mention concerns about business response to stock market fluctuations, the strong dollar, and political uncertainty due to the upcoming elections
Firms report a relatively benign pricing environment
Median sales prices increased, except in Connecticut where they decreased modestly
Given the relatively mild winter in most of New England, sales of seasonal items have been slow
Crop farmers continued to cut capacity following another year of low incomes coupled with unexpectedly small declines in input costs
Financial conditions tightened some
Energy and metals prices remained low
Overall, consumer credit demand grew slightly and loan quality was little changed
The reported pace of hiring picked up some, but remained slow overall
Nonresidential construction contacts reported little growth on balance, with a slowdown in industrial construction demand and little improvement elsewhere
The pace of sales of new and used light vehicles slowed some but remained strong and exceeded dealers' expectations
Coal production is lower
The demand for credit moved slowly higher

Business and consumer lending expanded modestly
since our last report
On balance, manufacturing payrolls expanded moderately across job segments
Nonresidential contractors reported very favorable results for 2015, and they expect 2016 will be moderately stronger
Our contacts credited low energy prices and expanded menu offerings for the increase
Contacts reported that low prices and weakening demand will likely result in fewer cotton acres planted this year
Manufacturing weakened modestly and reports from nonfinancial services firms were mixed
However, contacts across several industries noted difficulty finding workers
Business lending, including commercial and industrial loans and commercial real estate, increased but at a slower pace
Refinery utilization rates remained robust
Sales of moderately-priced homes were solid
Retail sales generally softened this reporting period
Energy activity declined moderately, and expectations remained pessimistic
Consumer spending decreased modestly as sales in the retail, auto, restaurant and tourism sectors fell
Transportation selling prices declined at a slower pace, and input prices increased slightly
Though most bankers reported steady overall loan demand, the proportion indicating weaker demand increased slightly compared to the results of the last survey
Manufacturers' capital spending plans fell moderately, even as expectations for future activity remained positive
Commercial real estate sales decreased and vacancy rates edged up
District tourism activity declined moderately and remained lower than a year ago
District agricultural conditions remained weak
The Ninth District economy grew modestly since the last report
Wge pressures were moderate
Activity among professional services firms was mixed
Residential construction rose moderately
Consumer spending was mixed since the last report
Agricultural economic conditions were flat to moderately down in reporting Districts since the previous report
In the banking and finance sector, most Districts reported slight to modest increases in loan demand, stable credit quality and unchanged credit standards
Wges generally increased, as most Districts experienced slight to strong wage growth
In St Louis, loan delinquencies were unchanged to slightly lower in all loan categories, but creditworthiness of applicants improved
Overall, nonfinancial services activity expanded slightly
Condo sales increased across the Boston and Cleveland Districts but slowed somewhat in New York City
Tourism activity declined moderately in the Kansas City District, although resort areas performed better
Consumer spending has been steady to up slightly in early 2016, while tourism activity has remained sluggish
Small- to medium-sized banks in the District report weakening demand for consumer loans and residential mortgages but rising demand from commercial borrowers
Manufacturers in the District report continued weakening in activity, while service-sector firms now also note that business has softened
The District's housing markets were stable to slightly softer in early 2016
Tourism activity has been stable at a fairly weak level
Homebuilding and loan volumes were reported as declining slightly after growing moderately last period
Overall, contacts continued to report little upward wage pressure
Most contacts continued to report few signs of inflation and remained optimistic for continued slow, steady growth in 2016
Wile shipments were somewhat positive, new orders declined further
Builders noted little concern about commodity costs, and as demand has slowed, labor costs have presented fewer problems
Despite the slow start, auto dealers continued to express optimism that sales volumes would remain high, if not increase, in 2016
Underlying agribusiness conditions were unchanged since the previous report, even as contacts cited a typical seasonal slowdown
Labor demand increased modestly
According to our most recent surveys, the pace of hiring increased modestly at manufacturing businesses and slowed at services firms
Since our previous Beige Book report, loan demand increased modestly
Moreover, automobile imports remained robust in recent weeks, despite seasonal slowing
Residential real estate activity grew modestly since the previous report
Retail sales strengthened moderately since the previous report
Contacts reported that domestic demand from restaurants slowed for some vegetable products
Retail sales expanded moderately, and demand for business services grew modestly
Wge inflation for workers in the financial services sector picked up
Lending activity grew modestly over the reporting period
Contacts noted that unfavorable export conditions and global uncertainty have held back capital expenditure plans for the coming year
Real estate market activity grew at a robust pace across most of the District
Sales of apparel products were flat, and suppliers struggled somewhat to clear inventories from a slower-than-expected holiday season
As of the end of January, almost 93 percent of the District winter wheat crop was rated fair or better

A survey of business contacts indicated that wage growth was strong, while employment and prices grew at a modest pace

Reports from the transportation sector were mixed
